CropFormations© 2003 by Linda Moulton Howe Soberton Heath south of Privett had the first crop formation of 2002,as Privett had the first of 2003. West and East Meon and Petersfield have repeatedlyreceived crop formations since the early 1990s. April 29, 2003 - I remembered that the first English formation last year on April12, 2002, had two small, standing crop circles in its outer ring. They were largerbut similar to the two in the ring surrounding the "broken 8" or "truncatedinfinity symbol" that is the first English crop formation in 2003. See: Earthfiles04-26-03. I have no idea what the meaning might be, nor what the source oftheir creation is, but thought I would share the comparison in this report. On left: Discovered Easter Sunday, April 20, 2003, about 150 feet diameterin oilseed rape at Privett, Hampshire, England. Aerial photograph © 2003 by DavidRussell.On right: Discovered April 12, 2002, about 50 feet in oilseed rape at Long Road, nearSoberton, Hampshire.Aerial photograph © 2002 by Peter R. Sorensen. Both formations have two small "beads"in their outer rings.

Soberton, Hampshire, U. K., April 12, 2002.Aerial photograph © 2003 by Peter R. SorensenApril 20, 2003, Privett, Hampshire, England, aerial photograph © 2003 by Lucy Pringle. Both Formations Difficult to See From GroundLast year of 2002, James Andrews reported to cropcircleconnector.com that he"spotted a circle on Friday, April 12, in a field of oilseed rape in Hampshire. ...itis on a slight hillside that is really only visible from one direction," at thenortheast end of Long Road, which is close to the village of Soberton inHampshire.This year of 2003, photographer, author and long-experienced crop formationinvestigator, Lucy Pringle, reported that she tried to find the Privett formationwith specific directions from pilot and photographer David Russell who hadflown over the field, but could not until April 29, when she finally reached theformation with the farmer's help. More details in upcoming Earthfiles.comreport.Privett formation photographed from abandoned rail embankmentto the south of the field © 2003 by Tony Purser.We b s it e s :http://www.swirlednews.com/http://home.clara.net/lucy pringle
